items.message:
Forecast rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 05 December 2025 . Flooding is also possible overnight into Saturday. 
Rivers are forecast to rise again due to the current band of heavy rain this afternoon, Friday 05 December 2025. Sherborne Lake is still high and remains above the Alert threshold. Flooding is possible on low lying land and roads near the River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle. Areas most at risk include the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Showers are forecast on Saturday followed by a moderate band of rain on Sunday. On Monday night into Tuesday, another heavy rain front is forecast, which could bring further flooding impacts. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Friday evening's tide at 23:30 on 05/12/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.25 m. Total forecast tide is 6.15 metres Chart Datum (3.10 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong South Westerly Force 6 wind. Small amounts of water will flood land and fields at Climping. Waves will overtop the sea front, directing water westwards along Mill Lane (from the right of the East car park) towards properties on Climping Street. Water may pond near property and in Climping Street Car Park. Saturday's tide at 11:45 06/12/2025 is forecast to be 3 cm lower (3.07 mAOD). Similar minor flood impacts are expected over all tides on Saturday and Sunday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Somerset coast at Dunster Beaches, Blue Anchor, Steart, Stolford and Brean
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06:00 AM to 08:00 AM on 06 December 2025. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Hinkley Point, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around coastal areas at Dunster Beaches, Blue Anchor, Steart, Stolford and Brean.  The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Hinkley of 6.65 mAODN at 07:00 AM on on Saturday 06 December 2025, with Force 7 Westerly winds. There are further high tides in this spring tide sequence but they are not currently forecast to meet the tidal Alert conditions. 
We are closely monitoring the situation .and checking flood defences. 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded Start acting on your flood plan if you have one 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves are expected to cause flooding tomorrow morning. 
Flooding is expected over the morning high tide on Saturday 6th December. 
Spray and wave overtopping of quaysides, harbours and low lying areas is expected to flood properties. Areas at risk include Wembury, Noss Mayo and Newton Ferrers. 

High tide at Plymouth on Saturday morning is at 06:12, times of high water will vary along the coast. The forecast total high tide level is 2.91mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.4m above tide table level. Strong force 7 westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4.0m are forecast. 

Conditions should ease slightly for Saturday evening's high tide, however flood alerts may remain in force. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded and activate any flood protection products you may have. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Hayling and South Eastoke seafront
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding on Saturday. 
Flooding is expected for 2 hours either side of Saturday morning's tide at 11:49 on 06/12/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.24 m. Total forecast tide is 5.23 metres Chart Datum (2.50 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Strong Westerly Force 5 wind. It is possible there will be water in the prom at high tide in the Eastoke Corner area. Local teams are monitoring the beach condition at Eastoke over the weekend for any further actions. Sunday's tide at 00:21 on 07/12/2025 is forecast to be 11 cm lower (2.39 mAOD). 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 4:30PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, River Cary

items.message:
Rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 05 December 2025 . Flooding may also be possible overnight into Saturday. 
The River Yeo is rising at Pen Mill gauge and is currently forecast to reach the Flood Alert level overnight at approximately 1:00AM. There is some uncertainty over this, therefore this Alert is precautionary. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads near the River Yeo, River Parrett and River Cary, particularly around the Ilchester to Yeovilton road at the end of the runway. Showers are forecast on Saturday followed by another band of rain on Sunday. On Monday night into Tuesday, another heavy rain front is forecast, which could bring further flooding impacts. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
